intro: Nothoscordum subsessile, commonly known as the narrowleaf garlic herb, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators, it is often cultivated in arid landscapes.
